intro: Gilia aristella, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Gilia aristella is adapted to withstand drought conditions and plays a role in providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
